abstract: It remains to be seen how the Bancrofts — most of whom have not been told what was in the agreement — will react.
snippet: It remains to be seen how the Bancrofts — most of whom have not been told what was in the agreement — will react.
lead_paragraph: A tentative accord on the editorial independence of The Wall Street Journal would leave Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation with the sole power to hire and fire The Journal’s top editors if it succeeds in buying the newspaper’s owner, Dow Jones & Company, people who have been briefed on the agreement said yesterday.

headline.main: Tentative Dow Jones Sale Pact Said to Give Murdoch Power to Hire and Fire at The Journal
headline.print_headline: Tentative Dow Jones Sale Pact Said to Give Murdoch Power to Hire and Fire at The Journal
